events.originalText: American climate activist Wynn Bruce set himself on fire outside the United States Supreme Court Building in an apparent protest against the climate crisis.
events.subtitle: Self-immolation of Wynn Bruce
events.headline: American climate activist Wynn Bruce sets himself on fire in protest outside US Supreme Court

events.originalText: The Paris Agreement, an international treaty on climate change, opened for signature and was signed by 175 parties.
events.subtitle: Paris Agreement
events.headline: Paris Agreement signed by 175 parties in international treaty on climate change

events.originalText: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police arrested two men who were plotting to commit terrorist attacks against Via Rail operations.
events.subtitle: Royal Canadian Mounted Police
events.headline: Two men arrested for plotting terrorist attacks against Via Rail operations in Canada

events.originalText: Flammable cargo exploded at a railway station in Ryongchon, North Korea, killing at least 54 people and injuring more than a thousand others.
events.subtitle: Ryongchon disaster
events.headline: Explosion at railway station in Ryongchon, North Korea kills 54 and injures over a thousand

events.originalText: In a pre-dawn raid, U.S. federal agents seized six-year-old Elián González from his relatives' home in Miami and returned him to his Cuban father.
events.subtitle: Elián González
events.headline: US federal agents seize Elián González from relatives' home in Miami, return him to Cuban father

events.originalText: Stephen Lawrence, a black British teenager, was murdered while waiting for a bus in Eltham, London, leading to cultural changes of attitudes on racism and the police, and to the law and police practice.
events.subtitle: Black British people
events.headline: Black British teenager Stephen Lawrence murdered in Eltham, London, sparking cultural changes

events.originalText: Korean War: The Chinese People's Volunteer Army attacked positions occupied mainly by Australian and Canadian forces, starting the Battle of Kapyong.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: Chinese People's Volunteer Army attacks Australian and Canadian forces in Battle of Kapyong

events.originalText: Civil War in Mandatory Palestine: The Jewish paramilitary group Haganah captured Haifa from the Arab Liberation Army.
events.subtitle: 1947–1948 civil war in Mandatory Palestine
events.headline: Haganah captures Haifa from Arab Liberation Army in Civil War in Mandatory Palestine

events.originalText: About 600 prisoners of the Jasenovac concentration camp in the Independent State of Croatia revolted, but only 80 managed to escape while the remainder were killed by the Ustaše regime.
events.subtitle: Jasenovac concentration camp
events.headline: Prisoners revolt at Jasenovac concentration camp in Croatia, 80 escape, others killed by Ustaše regime

events.originalText: The short-lived Transcaucasian Democratic Federative Republic was established on territory formerly part of the Russian Empire.
events.subtitle: Transcaucasian Democratic Federative Republic
events.headline: Transcaucasian Democratic Federative Republic established on former Russian Empire territory

events.originalText: The first meeting of the Colonial Defence Committee, a standing committee of the British Colonial Office, was held to discuss the defence of Barbados.
events.subtitle: Colonial Defence Committee
events.headline: Colonial Defence Committee holds first meeting to discuss defence of Barbados

events.originalText: The U.S. Congress authorized the creation of a two-cent coin (pictured), the first U.S. currency to bear the phrase "In God We Trust".
events.subtitle: Coinage Act of 1864
events.headline: US Congress authorizes creation of two-cent coin bearing phrase 'In God We Trust'

events.originalText: A fleet commanded by Pedro Álvares Cabral (pictured) anchored off present-day Brazil; he later claimed the land for the Portuguese Empire.
events.subtitle: Pedro Álvares Cabral
events.headline: Pedro Álvares Cabral anchors fleet off Brazil, claims land for Portuguese Empire
